intro: Orthandra nigeriana, commonly known as the Nigerian orthandra, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
